attributes.text:
The scroll bar widget, is a special slider, which is used in qooxdoo instead of the native browser scroll bars.

Scroll bars are used by the {@link qx.ui.container.Scroll} container. Usually a scroll bar is not used directly.

Example

Here is a little example of how to use the widget.

  var scrollBar = new qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar("horizontal");
  scrollBar.set({
    maximum: 500
  })
  this.getRoot().add(scrollBar);

This example creates a horizontal scroll bar with a maximum value of 500.

External Documentation

Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo wiki.

previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property knobFactor.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyKnobFactor}.

The change event object
Change listener for slider value changes.
Execute event of the button
Executed when the up/left button is executed (pressed)
Execute event of the button
Executed when the down/right button is executed (pressed)
event object
Hide the knob of the slider if the slidebar is too small or show it otherwise.

Returns the (computed) value of the property knobFactor.

Initial value for property knobFactor.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property knobFactor with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #knobFactor}.

the default value

Resets the user value of the property knobFactor.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #knobFactor}.

Scrolls by the given offset.

This method automatically corrects the given position to respect the {@link #maximum}.
Number of steps

Scrolls by the given number of steps.

The unmodified incoming value.
Factor to apply to the width/height of the knob in relation to the dimension of the underlying area.
The maximum value (difference between available size and content size).
The scroll bar orientation
The amount to increment on each event. Typically corresponds to the user pressing PageUp or PageDown.

Position of the scrollbar (which means the scroll left/top of the attached area’s pane)

Strictly validates according to {@link #maximum}. Does not apply any correction to the incoming value. If you depend on this, please use {@link #scrollTo} instead.
Step size for each click on the up/down or left/right buttons.
Fired on change of the property {@link #position}.
